resources.string: Espresso poured on a vanilla ice cream. Served in a cappuccino cup.

Espresso with added hot water (100-150 ml). Often served in a cappuccino cup. (The espresso is added into the hot water rather than all the water being flowed through the coffee that would lead to over extraction.)
A tall, mild \'milk coffee\' (about 150-300 ml). An espresso with steamed milk and only a little milk foam poured over it. Serve in a latte glass or a coffee cup. Flavored syrup can be added.

A classic Italian coffee drink made with equal parts espresso, steamed milk, and milk foam. The top layer of foam is often dusted with cocoa powder or cinnamon for extra flavor. Traditionally served in a small cup (150–180 ml), cappuccino offers a balanced taste between the strong intensity of espresso and the smoothness of milk. Best enjoyed fresh and hot.

A strong, concentrated coffee made by forcing hot water through finely-ground coffee beans under high pressure. Typically served as a single shot (25–30 ml) in a small demitasse cup. Espresso forms the base for many coffee drinks like cappuccino, latte, and macchiato. Known for its rich crema on top and bold flavor profile.
